replies.body:
I'm pretty sure that as soon as he finds out he's banned he will.

If I'm wrong, then I'm wrong. It's an issue of personal bias. That may be a negative word here on the Avicus network, but it is true. He is a friend and a teammate, I am entitled to take his side of the argument, which I possess the most knowledge of. However, if I end up being wrong, feel free to hit me up on Skype and I'll send you a dollar on PayPal.

replies.body: Well. Heavy objects don't move. Therefore no pixel missed. He can jitter whilst doing that (at about 12ish cps). In addition to this he has ammased a practice time of over two days jus bridging. It is quite legit .-. He is thinking about doing a mouse and keyboard video but we don't really want to do that, not wanting to be rude to anyone but it'd be nice for this to remain a relative secret on how do to it :/

replies.body: That type of bridging is meant for autoclickers. Someone without one tried it and said it is almost impossible unless you hit the right area of pixels and you can click the same amount of times per second. As this guy doesn't autoclick or modify his game and has been on badlion and hasn't been banned for autoclicking unlike some other bridgers, He said it was "A graveyard bridging technique"  which means it shows the person autoclicking way easier then other types of bridging like d bridging and q bridging[He names his own bridges] Also if you see Luigi's video it shows him doing unhuman type clicks, I rather trust Luigi who is unbaised then someone like you who may or may not seen the HUGE evidence of him autoclicking and says it is jitter clicking[which does shit for bridging but believe what you want]
